alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 5:00AM CDT until June 05 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Latimer, Le Flore and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Heavener... Talihina... Albion... Muse... Whitesboro... Big Cedar... Octavia... Talimena State Park... Heavener Runestone State Park... Kiamichi... Honobia... Hodgen... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
